chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq ", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines: Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts. Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'. Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary. Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided. Example 1: Hypotheses: n, m: nat IHn: m + n = n + m Goal: m + S n = S n + m Proof: ```coq simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto. Qed.``` Example 2: Hypotheses: Goal: forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m ```coq intros n m. induction n. - simpl. auto. - simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto. Qed.``` Solve This Proof State: Hypotheses: m2: list bool m1: list bool l: list bool Goal: list_bool_succ l m1 -> list_bool_succ l m2 -> m1 = m2 Premises: Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename Inductive list_bool_succ : list bool -> list bool -> Prop := in_lbs_0 : forall (k : nat) (l : list bool), list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: l) (list_repeat Zero k ++ One :: l) | in_lbs_1 : forall k : nat, list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k) (list_repeat Zero (S k)) Arguments list_bool_succ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lbs_0 _%nat_scope _%list_scope Arguments in_lbs_1 _%nat_scope Forall2_app_inv_l : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list X) (m : list Y), Forall2 R (l1 ++ l2) m -> {m1 : list Y & {m2 : list Y | Forall2 R l1 m1 /\ Forall2 R l2 m2 /\ m = m1 ++ m2}} Forall2_app_inv_r : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (l : list X) (m1 m2 : list Y), Forall2 R l (m1 ++ m2) -> {l1 : list X & {l2 : list X | Forall2 R l1 m1 /\ Forall2 R l2 m2 /\ l = l1 ++ l2}} in_lbs_1 : forall k : nat, list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k) (list_repeat Zero (S k)) in_lbs_0 : forall (k : nat) (l : list bool), list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: l) (list_repeat Zero k ++ One :: l) Inductive ascii : Set := Ascii : bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> Ascii.ascii Arguments Ascii.Ascii (_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _)%bool_scope andb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then b2 else Zero : bool -> bool -> bool Arguments andb (_ _)%bool_scope bool_eq = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then b2 else negb b2 : bool -> bool -> bool Arguments bool_eq (_ _)%bool_scope prefix_app_lft_inv : forall (X : Type) (l1 l2 m : list X), l1 ++ l2

{m2 : list X | m = l1 ++ m2 /\ l2

lb = list_nat_bool ln /\ Forall (fun x : nat => x < k) ln : nat -> list bool -> list nat -> Prop Arguments list_bool_valid _%nat_scope (_ _)%list_scope bool_ring_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (l : list bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l lH ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe = Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) Zero One bool_eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) (get_sign_None (C:=bool)) l npe xorb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then if b2 then Zero else One else if b2 then One else Zero : bool -> bool -> bool Arguments xorb (_ _)%bool_scope ext_in_filter : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l -> forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a filter_ext_in : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), (forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a) -> filter f l = filter g l list_nat_bool = fix list_nat_bool (ln : list nat) : list bool := match ln with | nil => nil | x :: ll => list_repeat Zero x ++ One :: list_nat_bool ll end : list nat -> list bool Arguments list_nat_bool _%list_scope map_ext_in : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), (forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a) -> map f l = map g l Zcomplements.Zlength_nil_inv : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), Zcomplements.Zlength l = BinNums.Z0 -> l = nil Permutation.Permutation_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' -> l' ~p l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, l ~p l0 -> P l l0 Add_ind : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), (forall l : list A, P l (a :: l)) -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), Add a l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> forall l l0 : list A, Add a l l0 -> P l l0 prefix_rect : forall (X : Type) (P : list X -> list X -> Type), (forall ll : list X, P nil ll) -> (forall (x : X) (l ll : list X), l

P l ll filter_ext : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool), (forall a : A, f a = g a) -> forall l : list A, filter f l = filter g l map_ext : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B), (forall a : A, f a = g a) -> forall l : list A, map f l = map g l bool_ring_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list bool) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe2 Permutation.Permutation_nil : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), nil ~p l -> l = nil incl_l_nil : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), incl l nil -> l = nil app_eq_nil : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A), l ++ l' = nil -> l = nil /\ l' = nil filter_ext_in_iff : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l < -> (forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a) list_bool_invalid = fun (k : nat) (lb : list bool) (ln : list nat) => exists lc : list bool, lb = list_nat_bool ln ++ lc /\ (Exists (fun x : nat => k <= x) ln \/ Forall (fun x : nat => x < k) ln /\ (exists p : nat, lc = list_repeat Zero (S p))) : nat -> list bool -> list nat -> Prop Arguments list_bool_invalid _%nat_scope (_ _)%list_scope map_eq_app : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (l1 l2 : list B), map f l = l1 ++ l2 -> exists l1' l2' : list A, l = l1' ++ l2' /\ map f l1' = l1 /\ map f l2' = l2 list_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Type), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l list_rec : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Set), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
